docs.lead_paragraph: Life as We Know It A Father, a Family, and an Exceptional Child. By Michael Berube. 284 pp. New York: Pantheon Books. $24. Some things having to do with children the heart can barely stand. When we read or hear stories telling of such things -- parental neglect, parental brutality, babies born addicted to cocaine, political torture, the list is unspeakably long -- we can only lower our eyes and wish for life to be otherwise, or for a different ending to the story.
docs.abstract: Beverly Lowry reviews book Life as We Know It: A Father, a Family, and an Exceptional Child by Michael Berube (L)
